alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 28 at 5:50AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Dense Fog Has Spread Across Western Okeechobee County... At 545 AM, surface observations and satellite imagery showed dense fog had spread from southwest Florida across the Kissimmee River from Basinger to near Okeechobee and Fort Drum. Visibilities were being reduced to between one quarter and one half mile across this area. The fog will persist past sunrise, before burning off by 9 AM. Motorists, traveling on U.S. Highway 98, State Roads 70 and 78, and possibly as far east as U.S. Highway 441 should prepare to encounter reduced visibilities in dense fog this morning. When driving in fog, reduce your speed, use your low beam headlights only, and leave extra distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you.
